html:
1.17.17  8:45 am   Sorry this is so long, I've just had a bunch of questions I've wanted to ask and I figured I might as well ask them all at once. From what I gather, the reason you don't collaborate is because you have a specific artistic vision (and a very specific style) for everything you do, and it would be very difficult to get someone else to use the same style or approach your work with the same vision.

Is there more to it than that?

Is that assumption even partially right? If so, what about collaborating on research for the History of Japan-style videos? I can't see how the style of presenting info would affect it. Is it just trustworthiness?

Also, am I right in assuming that one of the biggest priorities when designing this website is making it load as quickly as possible (since you mentioned you don't want to use graphics)?

or do you just prefer taking a minimalistic approach only because you like how it looks?

Also, if that's the case (minimalism and no graphics), how come you have a PayPal GIF hidden away at the bottom of your main page? Doesn't that run counter to the way you designed nearly every other page of this site?

As a side note I love the way this website is designed. Don't worry if someone tells you it's ugly or poorly optimised or whatever, because in terms of just loading time it's the most optimised site I visit, and the style isn't ugly, its just very distinctive and its kinda representitive of the style you use in some videos (and of your preference for how you want to display and sort your work).

If someone asks a question with spelling mistakes do you ever correct them? (so that the viewers can understand it)

If someone leaves their email or personal info in a question would you/do you ever remove it without their asking?

If I wanted to ask multiple questions, would you prefer a huge message like this, or would you rather have someone ask multiple questions seperately? (if it's the second one, sorry!)

Thank you for your time!
